assigmentName: AEB PREPARATION: Using Research in Writing
spaceName: AEB for Financial Economics and Banking (LONU045)

options.label: To show results from relevant research

data.stimulus:
TASK 1: Why should we use research in our academic assignments?

Choose ALL possible answers

value: Is the content connected to you what you are writing about? E.g. Is a book on marketing patterns in the US appropriate for your report on marketing in the UK?
Is the author qualified to write about the topic? Can you trust their opinion or their research?
Does the writer want to sell you an idea or opinion? Do they have an agenda?
Who was the writer writing for? e.g.  Academics? Students? The general public? Corporate clients?
Can you trust the sources and the research, which the author uses to support their theory or opinion?
Does the date of publication effect how relevant the source is to your own argument?

possible_responses: Can you trust the sources and the research, which the author uses to support their theory or opinion?
Who was the writer writing for? e.g.  Academics? Students? The general public? Corporate clients?
Does the date of publication effect how relevant the source is to your own argument?
Does the writer want to sell you an idea or opinion? Do they have an agenda?
Is the content connected to you what you are writing about? E.g. Is a book on marketing patterns in the US appropriate for your report on marketing in the UK?
Is the author qualified to write about the topic? Can you trust their opinion or their research?
data.stimulus:
TASK 2: Using the REVIEW method to choose appropriate research

Match the descriptions to each of the REVIEW criteria

value: Is the content connected to you what you are writing about? E.g. Is a book on marketing patterns in the US appropriate for your report on marketing in the UK?
Is the author qualified to write about the topic? Can you trust their opinion or their research?
Does the writer want to sell you an idea or opinion? Do they have an agenda?
Who was the writer writing for? e.g.  Academics? Students? The general public? Corporate clients?
Can you trust the sources and the research, which the author uses to support their theory or opinion?
Does the date of publication effect how relevant the source is to your own argument?

stems: Macdonalds is often accused of only make minimal efforts to be sustainable (Wikipedia, 2022)
Recent investigations have shown sustainable practice in the beauty industry is "only skin-deep"We  (Dolenz, 1983, p.12).
Sustainable production will soon be forgotten, along with other liberal trends (US Conservative, 2021)
Tork (2020) claims that households only account for 5% of C02 emissions
The impact of sustainable practices in manufacturing industries has been minimal
According to Costa's 2021 sustainability report, their competitors sustainability policies are appealing but ineffective.
data.stimulus:
TASK 3 PROBLEMS WITH EVIDENCE

A student is writing a report on sustainability in industry. They have found some evidence to support the idea that sustainability practices can be ineffective. However, there is a problem with the evidence they have found.
Use the grid to show the problem with each.

value: citing
reference list
citation and referencing
APA7
citations and a reference list
plagiarism
cite and reference
Quotation
Summarising & Paraphrasing

data.stimulus:
TASK 4: HOW TO INCLUDE RESEARCH IN YOUR WORK

Watch the following video from USU, which gives a brief introduction to referencing and citation, then drag and drop the correct words to complete the text below
data.template:
When you use research in your writing it is essential to show where the information comes from. We do this by  {{response}}, the author and date of publication in our text and by including full details of the source in a   {{response}}  at the end of our assignment. Different institutions use different   {{response}}  systems. At Coventry Univerisity London, we use   {{response}} , and full information on how to do this can be found on the Library Website. If you do not  use {{response}}, this means you are not giving credit to the author and you are 'stealing' their ideas or research. This is a serious offence at University, and is known as   {{response}} . It can result in lower grades or even failing a course. Make sure you    {{response}}  correctly to avoid  problems when you submit your work!

In the next section we will look at two different methods of putting research into our writing

{{response}} - including the exact words from the source

{{response}} - including information or ideas from the source using our own words

value: citing
reference list
citation and referencing
APA7
citations and a reference list
plagiarism
cite and reference
Quotation
Summarising & Paraphrasing
According to Jones (2019, p.124), new businesses need to enter the market "Tic-Toc smart and Insta-ready"
According to Jones (2019), new businesses need to plan for a strong social media presence when they enter the market.

While Jones (2019) emphasises the importance of embracing new media platforms when developing marketing plans, she argues that a campaign can only be successful if they are combined with more traditional media, such as print and television.

possible_responses: According to Jones (2019, p.124), new businesses need to enter the market "Tic-Toc smart and Insta-ready"
According to Jones (2019), new businesses need to plan for a strong social media presence when they enter the market.

While Jones (2019) emphasises the importance of embracing new media platforms when developing marketing plans, she argues that a campaign can only be successful if they are combined with more traditional media, such as print and television.
data.stimulus:
TASK 5: Quoting, Paraphrasing & Summarising

In task 4 we mentioned the different ways to CITE source material in your work. In the following exercise, read the description and label the examples appropriately
data.template:
How do we use them in our work?


Quoting involves copying short sentences or passages from the original text word-for-word places copied wording within “quotation marks”. You also need to give the page number. Below is an example of how to include a quotation in your writing using the APA7 reference style. (This is the style used at Coventry University and you will use it for all your assessments)

EXAMPLE: {{response}}


Paraphrasing involves putting a section of a text into your own words changes the words and phrasing of the original text, but keeps the original meaning of the text. Below is an example of how to include a paraphrase in your writing using the APA7 reference style.

 EXAMPLE: {{response}}


Summarising involves stating the main ideas and findings of a text into your own words presents a general overview, so is usually much shorter than the original text. Below is an example of how to include a summary in your writing using the APA7 reference style.

 EXAMPLE: {{response}}

value: According to Jones (2019, p.124), new businesses need to enter the market "Tic-Toc smart and Insta-ready"
According to Jones (2019), new businesses need to plan for a strong social media presence when they enter the market.

While Jones (2019) emphasises the importance of embracing new media platforms when developing marketing plans, she argues that a campaign can only be successful if they are combined with more traditional media, such as print and television.

stems: involves copying the exact words from a text
is much shorter than the original text
is usually only a short piece of text
presents a general overview of ideas and evidence from the original text
accurately presents an idea or piece of information from a text, but in your own words
should only be used if the exact words are important
demonstrate a good understanding of the text
data.stimulus:
TASK 6: Quoting, Paraphrasing & Summarising: Usage

Now complete the grid below based on the information above - some statements are true for more than one form of citation

TASK 7: ONLINE TOOLS TO HELP YOU WITH APA7 CITATIONS

The Coventry University London library referencing webpages: https://libguides.coventry.ac.uk/CULONAPA provide extensive information on how to create accurate APA7 citations for all the sources you use. Take time to explore these pages, so you know where to look when you complete your assignments.
RefWorks is a free REFERENCING SOFTWARE, which the university subscribes to. Search the library referencing pages and type the name of the other free software available in the box below!
